de.hardcode.jxinput
Class JXInputManager

java.lang.Object
  de.hardcode.jxinput.JXInputManager

public class JXInputManager
extends java.lang.Object

Manages the available instances of JXInputDevice. It holds the one central update method which synchronizes with the physical device.

Method Detail

getNumberOfDevices

public static int getNumberOfDevices()
Retrieve the number of available input devices.

getJXInputDevice

public static JXInputDevice getJXInputDevice(int idx)
Delivers the JXInputDevice with the desired index.

Take care that idx < getNumberOfDevices()!

reset

public static void reset()
Master reset for all devices and events. After calling reset(), better forget all devices created or retrieved. They are no longer valid. Event listeners will no longer be called and should be discarded.

updateFeatures

public static void updateFeatures()
Update the (shared) state of all features in one step. This method asks the actual device for a consistant state. After calling this method, all features may have new values. updateFeatures() is meant to be called e.g. once per frame in a gaming environment.

getLastUpdateTime

public static long getLastUpdateTime()
Get time when last update occurred.

Returns:
tickervalue in milliseconds

createKeyboardDevice

public static JXKeyboardInputDevice createKeyboardDevice()
Create a new pseudo-device.

createKeyboardDevice

public static JXKeyboardInputDevice createKeyboardDevice(java.awt.Component comp)
Create a new pseudo-device listening to a Swing component. Make sure that the component also has the keyboard focus!!

deleteKeyboardDevice

public static void deleteKeyboardDevice(JXKeyboardInputDevice dev)
Delete a keyboard device again e.g. when the corresponding JComponent gets deleted.

createVirtualDevice

Create a new pseudo-device.

deleteVirtualDevice

Delete a virtual device again.
